1995</div>
.<div type="canto" n="26" xml:id="krsnayana_01.27">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">tatkale halivat*nirāsmu sumə̄ṅ saṅ Ivir prabhāni śaśi,</l>
2000<l n="b">kerut miṅgut** ikaṅ vvaṅ iṅ paṅuṅaṅan harṣān tumon saṅ prabhu,</l>
.<l n="c">len vvaṅ tan huniṅe bəbədnika lukar siñjaṅnya tan kombarah,</l>
.<l n="d">vetniṅ buddhi girahyasən lagi madəg muṅggvī harəp vaspada.</l>
. <note>asmu sumə̄ṅ saṅ Ivir prabhāni śaśī (the one looking like the moon was shining brightly). The literal translation should be ’like shining was the one looking like the rays of the moon’.</note>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. livat.</app> -->
2005 <!-- <app>**B. A. miṅguk.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">vvantən strī ruməṅə̄-rəṅə̄* saṅ aharan Kr̥ṣṇa prakāśeṅ sarāt,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅke byakta katon svarupanira sākṣat kāmamurttyāṇḍarat,</l>
2010<l n="c">hetu nyān humənəṅ maṅən-(m)aṅənakən** tiṅhalnikānūtakən,</l>
.<l n="d">hāh liṅ nyān kavəṅan humaṅgut umiṅəl ṅkāścaryya(n) marmmākətək.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ruməṅə̄ saṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. məṅən-məṅənakən.</app> -->
.</lg>
2015<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">strī riṅ kuṇḍinarājya maṅkin asusun sār-sə̄k təkāmah gunuṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">kadyāpraṅ malavan vatək yadu silih taṅkis luṅidiṅ mata,</l>
.<l n="c">kapvādan maṅadəg vətisnya malaris himpər laras hyaṅ smara,</l>
.<l n="d">sākṣat hru ḍinavut lanāməkasi kuṅ ri tvas halis nyān tikəl.</l>
2020</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">ṅkāneṅ bapra savaṅ karaṅ-karaṅ aroṅ kirṇṇaṅ aniñjo pənuh,</l>
.<l n="b">tavvan jrah maṅisəp raras nyan agəlaṅ* lvir mūra mukṣeṅ səkar,</l>
.<l n="c">tovin rūmnya duveg havag mora madanyā**-lad(d)i muṅgvi mata,</l>
2025<l n="d">maṅgāroha manisnikaṅ*** vaṅ umulat maṅlampva yan kompəta****.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. agədaṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 49 ends here, followed by lontar 52.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. nika.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>****B. A. kompət.</app> -->
2030</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">sakveh nyāsanika kəneṅ turida tan tuṅgal paḍāpet raras,</l>
.<l n="b">sə̄ṅniṅ harsa ginūḍa somya humənəṅ kadyāmbəkiṅ satvika,</l>
.<l n="c">meṅgəp-meṅgəp amāviku*nya katəṅə māmbək kəḍap nyāṅliriṅ,</l>
2035<l n="d">rāgāhyun sinumūr haneṅ hati sinūkṣmāsraṅ masiṅgot halis.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. amāmaku.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->rāgāhyun sinumūr haneṅ hati sinūkṣmāsraṅ masiṅgot halis. Z.II.1776 reads sinukṣmāsraṅ maniṅgot alit. Siṅgot is a draw-beam, bamboo-lever to draw water from a well in a bucket. The keyword here is halis (eyebrow) which Zoetmulder reads as alit (fine, small, beautiful). Deriving from the literal meaning of siṅgot, I see in it an instrument which reveals the emotions buried so deeply in the hearts of the onlookers.</app> -->
.
.
2040</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">riṅ vantāyan alaryya-laryyan asənət kāvit hana striyāṅənes,</l>
.<l n="b">rəs-rəs nyān paṅulah i jro* mahaliṅan ṅkāne rahabniṅ gaḍuṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">rūm nyavarṇanikā katon muka-mukārapatan vaspada,</l>
2045<l n="d">mambvāmbək humiras-hiras** ri səkariṅ jaṅgenuṅas riṅ pipi.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. ijo.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. humiras hiris.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.27.07" n="7">
2050<l n="a">nāhan teki mahāmasah paṅuṅaṅan līlā visātālaṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="b">pantəs kārva bəbədnya raṇḍi salisih kumrām sinoṅsoṅakən,</l>
.<l n="c">raśmi nyān paṅagəm sərəh vəvər alum baṅgin masumpiṅ sipat,</l>
.<l n="d">məṇḍək yan haliṅan kikis vinulatan solahnya kadyāṅadəg.</l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->vəver alum baṅgin masumpiṅ sipat (but [one of them] seemed to wear a rod of withering young coconut leaves). Here there is mention of two people wearing the same clothes, standing very close together etc, so that they cannot be seen as two people of different gender, except that one of them is wearing a rod of withering young coconut leaves which reveals that she is a woman. This kind of scene is very common in Javanese literature, from Old Javanese to Javanese, e.g. in the Sərat Cənthini. In the RK, the behaviour of the crowd welcoming Rāma and Sītā back in Ayodhyā, is comparable with the above mentioned, e.g. RK 26.22 in translation reads as follows: ... The multitude was tumultuous, they jostled one another, they were affected by the sight of the king and queen loving each other. Some were offering garlands which could not be forwarded as they were pushed from behind. They turned angrily to those pushing them, asking them to stop, but in vain. Others were looking at one another, very much in love and were turned on, when they were pinched and poked, their breasts molested. ...</app> -->
2055</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" n="27" xml:id="krsnayana_01.28">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.01" n="1">
2060<l n="a">təlas kahalivat larīs nr̥pati tan vavarəṅə̄ kiṅ akuṅ kamānuṣan,</l>
.<l n="b">lanāṅhəla-həlā savaṅ panəḍəṅiṅ səkar asana ruru parəṅ ləvas*,</l>
.<l n="c">ləyəp kadi vulan kapiṅ lima sirāməkasi pətəṅ i cittaniṅ ma**-ṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">ləṅə̄ surupiṅ ārka saṅka ri katonanira pisaniṅun panoliha.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ləpas.</app> -->
2065 <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 52 ends here, followed by lontar 51.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">Amānuṣa kadarśaniyanira karaṇanikaṅ umulat paḍāṅucap,</l>
.<l n="b">vavaṅ prakaśitenaləm raras i rūpanira katəka riṅ nr̥pātmajā,</l>
2070<l n="c">apūrvva tinamuy-tamuy ri təka riṅ hrədaya pinapag ərəsiṅ hati,</l>
.<l n="d">umuṅgviṅ kucupiṅ puḍak sira sinaṅgraheṅ* sahaja linavva-lavvakən. </l>
. <!-- <app>c. B. tinamuy-tamuy...daya.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. sinaṅgrah iṅ sahaja.</app> -->
.</lg>
2075<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">sanāgara baṅun hinə̄makən ujarnya vijah uni manūk paḍāṅləm,</l>
.<l n="b">nda saṅ prabhu śaśāṅka saṅkādan irāṅiriṅ* baris** ira saṅ hañar ḍatəṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">katonan ira riṅ sabhādbhuta haləpniran aṅiriṅ i tiṅkahiṅ krama,</l>
.<l n="d">avarṇa śatapatra muṅgviṅ təṅahiṅ talaga rinubuṅ iṅ madhubrata.</l>
2080 <!-- <app>*S. AB. irāṅiri.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. garis.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">paran kari tinūtnirāpara-paran ta karaṇaniran aṅlavad-lavad,</l>
2085<l n="b">saṅ ārya pr̥thukīrtī r̥ṇanira tiṅkah ira sira tikāri niṅ bapa,</l>
.<l n="c">nda sānak amisan gati nr̥pati kr̥ṣṇa kalavan ika saṅ suputrikā,</l>
.<l n="d">nimittanira milva riṅ varaṅanāṅarivuvu təka so talahiṅ kadaṅ.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.05" n="5">
2090<l n="a">kunəṅ bhayanikāṅ ulah səḍəṅ irān maṅimur-imura vadva-vadvana*,</l>
.<l n="b">umañjiṅa mare daləm hanahəle səgə-səgəhana de nr̥pātmajā,</l>
.<l n="c">ikaṅ raras sumaṇḍiṅe vərə-və*-rə lituhayu** tuvi yogya kahyuna,</l>
.<l n="d">həduk maparəkeṅ apuy riṅa-riṅan riṅ apa gatinikān tan evəha. </l>
. <!-- <app>a. B. maṅirnur-imura vanva-vanvana.</app> -->
2095 <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 51 ends here, followed by lontar 54.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. liṅtuhayu.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\-> həduk maparəkeṅ apuy riṅa-riṅan riṅ apa gatinikān tan evəha? (when black fibre of the sugar palm is put near fire. Why should there be no trouble?). The expression is very welknown in Javanese with no change of meaning.</app> -->
.
.
2100
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">pitovi hana vr̥tta mātra kareṅə̄ dyah anu mavarah arahasyani,</l>
.<l n="b">ri buddhi parameśvari harəp amantva karəsəp ira* kr̥ṣṇa tan vaneh,</l>
2105<l n="c">kunaṅ nr̥patiputrikā kasəpuhan** hyun ira sinahakāryan i bibi,</l>
.<l n="d">sumavvana tikaṅ kunir lintəṅan kadi salaga məkar kagəntəran.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. A. hi rəsəp ira. B. kirəsəp ira.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. kasəpahan.</app> -->
. <note>kunir lintəṅan. The meaning of linteṅan is not known to me, and it is not listed in any of the dictionaries I use. I think it is a kind of turmeric. G &amp; R. II.86 has lintiṅan (rolled s.t.) which in my view is not fitting in this case.</note>
2110</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">nihan vuvusiṅ ogha saṅ nr̥pati bhiṣmaka sira bapa yukti katvaṅa,</l>
.<l n="b">pakon ira majantəne nr̥pati cedi ratu taruṇa yogya kahyuna,</l>
2115<l n="c">lulut ri basudevaputra sagunuṅ kapana ta sira tan viraṅrvana,</l>
.<l n="d">baṅun lumaku tan vruh iṅ havan aṅepvan apan* anəmu simpaṅiṅ hənū. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. kapan.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
2120<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.28.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">kunəṅ nr̥pati cedi cittanira varṇa kayu ragas aṅantyakən javuh,</l>
.<l n="b">ndikin luputa sinvam i jəriṅ i taṅan hiḍəp ira niyatān kasumpiṅa,</l>
.<l n="c">lanābhimata yan* papaṅgiha lavan sira saṅ ahayu ratnaniṅ puri,</l>
.<l n="d">manahnira harəp-harəp kadi manahniṅ api bañu maṅantya dāsina.</l>
2125 <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->ndikin luputa sinvam i jəriṅ i taṅan hiḍəp ira niyatān kasumpiṅa (How could the sprout of a jəriṅ plant escape from his hands, for sure he would be able to seize it). J.p.211 renders jəriṅ or jiriṅ witha name of a tree, Lagerstroenia L. I understand jəriṅ as just a plant, not a tree as J, because it seems that the jəriṅ must be a small plant and very weak.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. tan.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->kadi manahniṅ Apibdañu maṅantya dāsina. I read Apibañu as Abimañu, because the phrase reminds me of the romantic scenes in Ghaṭotkacāśraya or in the wayang play concerning the romance of Abimanyu and Sundarī, the daughter of Kr̥ṣna.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
2130
.<div type="canto" n="28" xml:id="krsnayana_01.29">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">nāhan pājarnikaṅ vvaṅ maguñəpan aṅucap kr̥ṣṇa sāmpun pralabda,</l>
2135<l n="b">tan sa*-h sakvehnikā saṅ yadubala baladevādi maṅgalya śakti,</l>
.<l n="c">śīghrā tiṅkah pinarṇṇah sira dinunuṅakən ṅkā ri heṅniṅ kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="d">āpan sār sə̄k təkeṅ bvat vataṅan alun-alun de vatək cedi rāja.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 54 ends here, followed by lontar 53.</app> -->
.</lg>
2140
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">ratrī sāmpun ḍatəṅ cedi rumuhun adulur mvaṅ jarasandha tan sah,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅgvan saṅ nātha hinastryan vəgilan iran ināptyakən apan ginə̄ṅ iṅ tvas,</l>
.<l n="c">prāptā ṅ annādi len modaka sərəh asabuk mvaṅ burat mrik vaṅinya,</l>
2145<l n="d">vvaṅ ri jro strī təkāsih marək amamarəṅə̄n solahiṅ kāku mantu.</l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->The word kaku becomes kakuṅ in Javanese. The Javanese form of kaku mantu is mantu kakuṅ (son–in–law, bridegroom).</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.03" n="3">
2150<l n="a">maṅkātah kr̥ṣṇa sāmpun ta sira hinaturan sopacaropakāra,</l>
.<l n="b">ndan tiṅkahniṅ tamuy tiṅkah iran inuniṅan riṅ taḍah rāja yogya,</l>
.<l n="c">sə̄h noraṅsal təkeṅ vr̥ṣṇi yadukula kabeh śūra sāmantarāja,</l>
.<l n="d">āmbək śrī bhiṣmakāramba duga-duga ri saṅ devakiputra masih. </l>
. <!-- <app>d. B. devaki...</app> -->
2155</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">ndan saṅ śrī Krəṣṇa motus majaruman anilib* mañjiṅe jro kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="b">strī prajñā kaṇṭi** riṅ buddhi tama ri pakəkəs rīṅgitāniṅ kinoṅkon,</l>
2160<l n="c">maṅkat lampus lari nyān laku tan avədi yan mātya deniṅ kabhaktin,</l>
.<l n="d">lila nirvighna*** riṅ margga**** [səḍə]ṅ arañca[k ta yeka]na***** siddhi kārya.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. animit.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. kaṇṭa.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. niṅ vighna.</app> -->
2165 <!-- <app>****B. Lontar 53 ends here, followed by lontar 56.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*****S. AB ...ṅ aranca...na siddhi.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.05" n="5">
2170<l n="a">kintu śrī rukmiṇī rakva səḍəṅ (ṅ)amər-amər ī taman tuṅga-tuṅgal,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅlilākən huyaṅ*niṅ hati sakamatan aṅde laṅə̄ paṅlipur kuṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">meh-meh sandhyā** marekaṅ divasa səninikaṅ kayvan abhrā mirahnya,</l>
.<l n="d">mrak nyāṅokok ana vvaṅ laki-bini muli[h] ṅāmər*** ta yāmet paturvan.</l>
. <!-- <app>a. B. səḍəṅ amər-amer iṅ.</app> -->
2175 <!-- <app>*B. A. huya.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. meh-meh...ndhyā.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. muliṅāmā.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
2180<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">padmāṅanti təṅahniṅ talaga vahu məkar heva miṅkus lavə̄nya,</l>
.<l n="b">miṅgut molah təkapniṅ bhramara kajənəkan darpa deniṅ rəbuk*nya,</l>
.<l n="c">saṅhubni vve mələk maṅkin aṅaraman i sinvamniṅ aśoka rāmbay,</l>
.<l n="d">tuñjūṅ bāṅ sə̄h karurvan asana caraṇa mābhra rinəṅga tulis mās.</l>
2185 <!-- <app>*B. A. rətuknya.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">luṅniṅ jaṅgāṅayuh pāṅ mavilət apuliran Ivir kale ləsva-ləsvan,</l>
2190<l n="b">paṇḍan keṅis puḍaknyāniru vətis alaris vāhu sāmpun dinamvan,</l>
.<l n="c">abhrā lvir bhāsma sāśrī kadi havu rumarab rūmni sarinya kegū,</l>
.<l n="d">maṅde harṣa ṅ kuraṇṭārja səkar ika baṅun vr̥tiniṅ jīva-jīva.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.29.08" n="8">
2195<l n="a">kāvit ken rājaputryaṅaraṅ i pariginiṅ nāgapūṣpāṅudodha,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkā prāpta ṅ rāja cedi rəsəp umarək i sor kapvanambah* maluṅguh,</l>
.<l n="c">śīghrān pamvat karas mājar iki yan inutus śrī mahārāja kr̥ṣṇa**,</l>
.<l n="d">norā puṅkas vagəd rūmni vuvus ika sinaṅkṣepa de saṅ kəneṅ kuṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. kapvanambuh.</app> -->
2200 <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 56 ends here, followed by lontar 55</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
.
.<div type="canto" n="29" xml:id="krsnayana_01.30">
2205
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.30.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">āmbək śrīvara rukmiṇī paramagarjita [hilaṅ pi]naka pratāpita*,</l>
.<l n="b">mantuk riṅ gr̥ha harṣa cittanira lāgi vinuni kadi tan girahyasən,</l>
.<l n="c">rūmniṅ reka vināspadākə̄n inamər vinaca cinarite daləm hati,</l>
2210<l n="d">sākṣat lvīr aṅure maṇik vulat irān paṅiliṅi** bhāṣa riṅ ṭika. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. paramagarjita......naka pralāpita. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. paṅiliṅ-iliṅ bhāṣa.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.30.02" n="2">
2215<l n="a">yat maṅjanma dlāha kambaṅ asanāpusən araras arupa mānuṣa,</l>
.<l n="b">rāmya ṅvaṅ harasən pakānak-anakan lagi asərəhan avoṅən i taman,</l>
.<l n="c">yapvan māsa sirəm-sirəm niyatākun aviṅita ya kāreṅə̄ gərəh,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkā tan sāha ri həmbanan turu-turun həmuk-həmukan asusva-susvana.</l>
.</lg>
2220<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.30.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">rakryan tiṅhali tonən iṅ lələh akuṅ maguliṅan apulaṅ lavan ṭikā,</l>
.<l n="b">tan śobhā sahajākaraṅhulu karasnya makukuba saput-saput mata,</l>
.<l n="c">śoka glana taṅiskvinduṅ yan aharip* anatun atərāṅhəmu səpah,</l>
.<l n="d">ndā tan vruh ri hilini luhnika kuməmbeṅ i taliṅa tumūs tinurvakən. </l>
2225 <!-- <app>*S. A. taṅis kiduṅ nyan harip. B. taṅis kiduṅ nyan aharip.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.30.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">vruhkun tvaṅta marāma-reṇa riṅ apan ta kita vənaṅa rājalaṅghana,</l>
.<l n="b">saṅ rovaṅta pināyvakən tuhan adoh* vuruṅa kadi pupur haneṅ taṅan,</l>
2230<l n="c">ndān iṣṭanya ya**-yañ juga ṅvaṅ amalar tiliṅan i turidanta ri ṅhulun,</l>
.<l n="d">apan kveh vvaṅ atiṅgal iṅ*** gaḍuṅ arūm kapahiriṅ i pañaṇḍiniṅ vuṅu.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. tuhan... vuruṅa.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 55 ends here, followed by lontar 58.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. i gaḍuṅ.</app> -->
2235</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.30.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">heman dyahku mareṅ vaneh* pituvin antukiṅ amana-manāmalar-malar,</l>
.<l n="b">riṅ nyūdanta raras ta ṅuni hiniras-hiras** inusap-usap tiniṅhalan,</l>
.<l n="c">rūmte cāmpaka māsku lagi hinəlar-həlaran i həlariṅ madhubrata,</l>
2240<l n="d">vāhvāgātra katon ulihniṅ amiñik-miñik i mora tuvuhta ri ṅhulun.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. mareṅ adoh pituvin.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. hinaris-haris.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
2245<div type="canto" n="30" xml:id="krsnayana_01.31">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.31.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">hariṅkvīnduṅ saṅ lvīraṅ inaṅ iri* kəmbaṅniṅ asana,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅanti nūsārəs apituvin adoh nora havana,</l>
2250<l n="c">arah nirvvāhyunkvāṅarasa ri tuvuhtebu rabhasan,</l>
.<l n="d">manahkvāṅhrət ndātan vənaṅ asmu kuməmbəṅ kaləmahan. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. A. inaṅ i. B. inaṅi ni. d. B. asmu kuməmbaṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.31.02" n="2">
2255<l n="a">ndan nāhan rūmniṅ rājavacana vilasenamər-amər,</l>
.<l n="b">ya tānde kiṅkiṅ riṅ nr̥patiduhita kembəhan unaṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">katon səṅ-sə̄ṅniṅ rāga ri hati baṅun vr̥tti kumitir,</l>
.<l n="d">rəsəp maṅkin marmmāmaṅan i pamanasnye pusu-pusuh.</l>
.</lg>
2260<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.31.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">ikīṅ āmbək glānāmuvuhi hayu mār maṅkin araras,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅə̄ ləṅləṅ luh ya mahayu rakət iṅ roma riṅ pipi,</l>
.<l n="c">sumidūniṅ śocāmirahi panasiṅ luh hinusapan,</l>
.<l n="d">sipat mātra gātranya ri mata paśesān rinahupan. </l>
2265 <!-- <app>c. B. suṅ madhuniṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.31.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">madəg mintar ṅkāne natar amariṅin* sāmpun asalin,</l>
.<l n="b">asiñjaṅ raṇḍyalīt kadi rudhira sāmpun hinirisan,</l>
2270<l n="c">madandan siṅsətni tapih inuvahan** rakva vinəḍar,</l>
.<l n="d">baṅun buṅkahniṅ danta panəpinirān keṅis abuṅah. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 58 ends here, followed by lontar 57.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. inuvuhan.</app> -->
.</lg>
2275<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.31.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">hanekiṅ ceṭi vallabha* marək i jə̄ṅ śrī nr̥patisutā,</l>
.<l n="b">mapet lisyan denyāpitutur** amaṅun bhāṣa racana,</l>
.<l n="c">ginuptāmor iṅ ketaka salaga vimbānak-anakan,</l>
.<l n="d">katon pvekā tandvān*** vinulatan i raśminya rinasan.</l>
2280 <!-- <app>*B. A. deni valana.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. nyāpitur.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->bhūsa racana (literary composition, flower arrangement). J on p.454 renders racana with werk, stijl, aanleg, bouwwerk, versiering (work, style, set up, plan, ornament). From J. I deduct the meaniṅ of bhāsa racana as meaning language of ornamentation —> art of ornamentation —> flower arrangement. In Bahasa Indonesia the word mengarang can mean mengarang cerita (to write or compose stories etc) and mengarang buṅa (to arrange flowers).</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A.t dvān.</app> -->
.</lg>
2285</div>
.
.<div type="canto" n="31" xml:id="krsnayana_01.32">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.01" n="1">
2290<l n="a">rakryan hayva jənək dahat ri ləṅəṅiṅ taman apitutura ṅhulun təmən,</l>
.<l n="b">mambə̄ rūmni səkar katon vavarəṅo bhaya ri paṅupətiṅ madhubrata,</l>
.<l n="c">saṅsiptānya tuhanku hayva kavəḍar səmuniṅ turida kūṅta sukṣmanən,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhiṅ-ṅhiṅ unta* marā ṅ atat syuṅ apitovi yayan** asahuran paḍāṅucap.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. nunta.</app> -->
2295 <!-- <app>**B. A. yayad.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">dyah maṅken pasavit gaḍuṅ rari gəluṅta linaraṅan avuntəlan səkar,</l>
2300<l n="b">marmma ṅvaṅ riki tān karəṅvan amagantakna kakavin eñjuh iṅ laṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="c">nāntən māsku sumə̄ṅ-sumə̄ṅte ratu* kr̥ṣṇa pinaguñəpakən pinivruhan,</l>
.<l n="d">vr̥ttantenucap aṅrva sumpiṅ amukut-mukuti puḍak i siṅhəliṅ sabuk. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. A. sumə̄ suvə ta vatu. B. sumə̄ṅ suvəṅta vatu.</app> -->
.</lg>
2305
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">ken putri varā, rukmiṇī sipi kəna priya rikaṅ upadhāra sukṣmanən,</l>
.<l n="b">ndan rakveki laris pisan təkani deniṅ umula*-t i valə̄riṅ** ākṣara,</l>
.<l n="c">səṅ-sə̄ṅ heva tuhun ri heṅ*** juga pinəm guyunira**** kikəkəs hane hati,</l>
2310<l n="d">arvāmbək***** rəṅuniṅ halisnira sahampru sinahaja vinor****** lavan madhu.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 57 ends here, followed by lontar 60.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. vaṅənuriṅ ākṣara.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. ri he juga.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>****A. guyu kinəkəs.</app> -->
2315 <!-- <app>*****S. AB. arvāmbak.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>******B. A. vino lavan.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.04" n="4">
2320<l n="a">praptekaṅ paricārika sama marək vruhan iki katahān tan āgata*,</l>
.<l n="b">ndā sākṣāt makəkəs maṇik sira rinākṣa kuməñəpi lulut suputrikā,</l>
.<l n="c">akareṅgita len gatīrika pañihna hala-hayunikaṅ ulah kabeh,</l>
.<l n="d">nāhan hetu nirāpisādhu səmuniṅ turida vinuni tan vināhyakən. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. kanāgata.</app> -->
2325</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">nāntən śrī vara rukmiṇī kasalimūr turidanira pijər girahyasən,</l>
.<l n="b">harṣānon ləṅə̄niṅ natar kasuluhan vulan apaḍaṅ avā magantaran,</l>
.<l n="c">ambə̄niṅ kamuniṅ sugandha kasirir saha kirisik i ronya kāṅinan,</l>
2330<l n="d">lumrā lvir tataliṅ gaḍiṅ lavə̄-lavə̄nya kasavur irikaṅ śitā tala.</l>
. <!-- <app>b. B. harṣān ton.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">lavan* tiṅkah ikaṅ paṅarccanan arūm rinacana leṅə̄ṅiṅ karaṅ liman,</l>
2335<l n="b">maṅkā taṅ kukusiṅ samiddha tarikəlnya mələk asmu raśminiṅ lulut**,</l>
.<l n="c">sinvamniṅ kayu tejamantən akiris mələs i rəsəp i sātnikaṅ həbun,</l>
.<l n="d">kumram komala koneṅ-oneṅ akilā kadi vinulih i tejaniṅ vulan.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. savaṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. lilit. c. B. i sāṅ nikaṅ.</app> -->
2340</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">strīṅ antahpura rāmya sə̄h maməṅ-aməṅ paḍa mavija*-h arumpukan səkar,</l>
.<l n="b">asrat tekaṅ agoṣṭhi tiṅkahanikaṅ avarah ulaha ken suputrikā,</l>
.<l n="c">ajrih ta r matur i turi[da] kadi kapeṅin ataña-taña karmma riṅ tapī,</l>
2345<l n="d">lāvan tekaṅ asaṅghani** rva sadulur saha kusuma paḍāṅagem havu. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 60 ends here, followed by lontar 59.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\-> pasavit gaḍuṅ... gəluṅ linaraṅan avuntəlan səkar. It seems that a necklace or garland of gaḍuṅ flowers is a sign that a girl is already engaged. In Javanese court circles, ladies and female attendants can still be recognized by the style of their hair-knot, when making their audience to the king or queen. Especially the hairknot of a bride has a special name and style. See e.g. ’Upacara mantu karaton Surakarta’, in Relung Pustaka, Augustus 1980. In Bali, the young unmarried girl is still recognizable by the style of hairknot, namely the end of the hair is hanging loosely down, while that of the married woman has its end turned inside.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. asangguni rwa.</app> -->
.</lg>
2350<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">akveh nyāsanika hanāṅulah-ulah* pinakajuru yan iṅ paləmburan,</l>
.<l n="b">len tekaṅ para vāla ken mavurahan paḍa rara-rara** solahiṅ rare,</l>
.<l n="c">aṅde harṣa mirəṅ*** sabhāva****ni kapantəs agaga-gagakan magənturan,</l>
.<l n="d">byaktāron asulur laṅə̄ turidaniṅ mulata riṅ asuhun-suhun***** huvi.</l>
2355 <!-- <app>*S. A. hanāṅulih ulah. B. hanāṅulih-ulih.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->paləmburan (amusement house). Z. I.1005 renders ləmbur with ’to work until late into the night’. I think the word ləmbur first has the meaning of libur ’to rest; to amuse oneself’, and the Javanese word ləmbur which means ’to work until late in the night’, first means ’working using the time of rest’.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. paḍa rarara.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***S AB. hirəṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>****B. A. sanāva.</app> -->
2360 <!-- <app>*****B. A. asuhan-suhan.</app> -->
. <!--<p><!-\-note for the reading-\->asuhun-suhun huvi. Here the keyword is huvi ’a kind of yam’. Ashun-suhun huvi ’to carry huvi yam’ is part of the lyrics of a game called Paman Doblang, with much singing and merriment, played by young girls on a moonlit night. The lyrics of the tune Paman Doblang tell the story of people asking instructions about the way to dig uvi jams, followed by collecting them, carrying, washing, peeling, cooking, eating and last getting intoxicated from eating them. Each stage is re-enacted by all players, and it is their movements that bring laughter and merriment to the onlookers.</p>-->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.09" n="9">
2365<l n="a">varṇṇan tekaṅ ajoṅ ikaṅ ri təṅah arja vinuni masaput-saput mirir,</l>
.<l n="b">reh-rehniṅ mukha ta* katon kadi vulan makalaṅan atavə̄ṅ himānipis,</l>
.<l n="c">aśrī rāmya ṅ aməñji-məñji rəjaniṅ jariji tumiru paṅjrahiṅ bakuṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">sə̄h taṅ striyakilusū ruyuṅ vətis ikābuṅah amaḍa puḍak hinuvakən**. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. tan.</app> -->
2370 <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->aməñji-məñji derived from pañji. I render aməñji-məñji with singing the story of Pañji, or to dance the maskdance. In the RK 25.85cd this re-enəctment of Pañji is also performed by girls looking for recreation, which reads as follows: puji mapañji mapiñjuṅa meñjuha, jaga ta saṅ tapa denya maṅel kumə̄l ’they sang the story of Pañji, while wearing their clothes high and skilfully, which made it hard and difficult for the priests to control their emotions’. It is only found once in the RK, and I think both texts support each other that panji is meant.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->sə̄h taṅ striyakilusā ruyuṅ. J on p.475 renders ruyuṅ with voetklem; voetaṅel (mantrap), and on p. 138 kilusuh with verlept (worn out, withered, tired). I suspect that akilusū ruyuṅ is another game of the girls like the asuhun-suhun huvi game which is accompanied by the tune Paman Doblang. The keyword here is akilusū which sounds so close to sluku-sluku bathok. This sluku-sluku bathok game is performed as follows: The girls are sitting in a circle with their legs stretched forward. Their two hands move forward and back, as if massaging the legs. They move from one leg to the other, while singing "Sluku-sluku bathok, bathoke ela-elo etc". So, sluku-sluku seems to be a corrupt form of akilusu (tired) and the way they play the game we can see that they act like being very tired. Because of the movements of the hands, the kain of the girls are usually rolled up, revealing the calf of legs as mentioned in the 4th line (vətis ikābuṅah amaḍa puḍak...,</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. A. hinəvakən. B. hinəmakən.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.10" n="10">
2375<l n="a">tiṅkah-tiṅkah ikāṅ ataṇḍak alaṅə̄ kadi ratih adulur matuntunan,</l>
.<l n="b">aṅde harṣa taṅ agra marmma panapaknya kadi panapakiṅ calānukər,</l>
.<l n="c">anyā taṅ mavisik rarasni vacananya tuna-tuna parəknya riṅ kapə̄*,</l>
.<l n="d">rāmyaniṅ dadi tuṅgak aṅhirasi rū**-m nyan umarək amarantyakən pipi.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. kahə.</app> -->
2380 <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 59 ends here, followed by lontar 62.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->This stanza refers to the enactment of the Smaradahana, in which Ratih was looking for the body of her husband, then followed her husband in death. See Smaradahana cantos 20-24. In the Smaradahana the goddess Ratih was burnt to ashes. In this text however, in the enactment she turned into a tuṅgak (trunk of a dead tree). I translate it in accordance with the Smaradahana.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.11" n="11">
2385<l n="a">vvantən ləṅləṅ aturva-turvan amiśata maguliṅ irikaṅ śilātala,</l>
.<l n="b">jrah śrīdanta rurū ryavaknya lagi nir vavarəṅə̄ hi rarabnikaṅ həbun,</l>
.<l n="c">aṅde harṣa kusut-kusutni gəluṅanya muray inaras iṅ haṅin mirir,</l>
.<l n="d">baṅgiṅ rakva susup-susupnika kunaṅ-kunaṅ araras inaṅsəlan mənur. </l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->d. B. baṅgī</app> -->
2390</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.12" n="12">
.<l n="a">ndah sāmpun lalu māsa tan* pahuvusan saṅ aməṅ-aməṅ atimbun iṅ natar,</l>
.<l n="b">lilābhāṣa kiduṅnya nr̥tta hana tāni-tāni tan alaha ṅ dalih parih,</l>
2395<l n="c">asraṅ tekaṅ sindhyan atəmah guyu-guyunika tan pakaraṇa,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅ strī-striyatuha riṅ karandhan aturū lagi baribin akon umuṅguha.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. halu māsa taman.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.13" n="13">
2400<l n="a">meh-mehniṅ* rahināsāmun səmunikaṅ gagana lalu huvus tiba ṅ həñəm,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkāne jro pakagan manuknya muni lāgi sinahuran ikaṅ manuk jarah,</l>
.<l n="c">vintaṅ śukra mijil sənə̄nika satāñjuṅ araras anuvəṅ haneṅ kapə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅ hyaṅ lek alaṅə̄ kinūsa kinupat-kupatan i sahabiṅ himānipis. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ni.</app> -->
2405 <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->manuk jarah is contrasted with the birds in the cages, hence the translation into ’birds living in the wild’.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.14" n="14">
.<l n="a">ndan rakryan vara rukmiṇī tucapa vāhu mavuṅu rumaras tikaṅ hati,</l>
.<l n="b">apan byakta meəne rikaṅ rahina rakva piniḍuḍuk i tambay iṅ gave,</l>
2410<l n="c">glānāśa sidəhāṅligāpan pi tan vavare*-ṅə̄ hi lukarnikaṅ gəluṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">təg nər cittanirāṅdadak kətəg ikaṅ hr̥daya təkap i paṅgyatiṅ curiṅ**.</l>
. <note>təkap i paṅgyatiṅ curiṅ (because someone was coming). The literal translation should be ’because of the ringing of footbells, or because footbells were heard’. Foot-bells are still worn by Madurese and some East Javanese women and girls and in dances from these regions, the dancers are still exploiting the footbells as very effective means to keep the attention of the audience. In wayang figures these footbells are still frequently found.</note>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 62 ends here, followed by lontar 61. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. curi.</app> -->
2415</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.15" n="15">
.<l n="a">ndah sāmpun mari kaṅ pasaṅgrahan umah ṅgvananira pinarək vinurṣita,</l>
.<l n="b">aṅhiṅ tovanireṅka saṅ vavarəṅə̄ha karacananikaṅ paliṅgihan,</l>
2420<l n="c">apan tan hana len maṅavruhi satiṅkah an i gati narendraputrikā,</l>
.<l n="d">tovin yogya təmən sirānuha-nuhani saphala pinakadimaṅgala.</l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->The word tova is derived from ta (particle for emphasis) and uva (aunt; lady in vaitiṅ). In Javanese courts as well as in well-to-do families in Java, young children used to have minders. These minders consisted of old women, usually called mbok əmban, but in court circles beside these minders, the little princesses had also companions consisting of daughters of the nobility. Princes had also sons of the nobility as companions, beside older minders or servants. Even in the Rāmāyana kakavin these minders are already mentioned, e.g. RK. 23.37:
. Vvara rākṣasottama ṅaranya kampana akampanākhya nipuṇa,
. kalavan prajaṅgha si vilohitākṣa karəṅə̄ dhvajākṣa savaneh,
2425 ya tikā rumākṣa si nikumbha kumbha umakuṅ vatək vrayalaha,
. (There were outstanding demons called Kampana, Akampana, Prajaṅgha, Vilohitākṣa, Dhvajākṣa, who were known as mighty and skilled in combat. They were the minders of Nikumbha and Kumbha who wished to defeat the monkey-host.)</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.16" n="16">
2430<l n="a">prapta ṅ danta palaṅka sāmpun acaḍaṅ śayana vuluṅ atumpa taṅkəpan,</l>
.<l n="b">membuh śrī binəlah* kaḍatvan-ṅ mās ri təpi-təpi ginatra ri tatur,</l>
.<l n="c">ṅkānekaṅ suragāhaləp saha patāraṇa valunika ratna kāmbala,</l>
.<l n="d">lāvan pəṇḍiṅ gadiṅ sumaṇḍiṅ arəjeṅ hiriṅan apənəd esi pahyasan. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. banəlah.</app> -->
2435</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.17" n="17">
.<l n="a">mrik āmbə̄ kasirir tikaṅ saji dukūla saji pinakasampi-sampiran,</l>
.<l n="b">luṅsir konəṅ-unəṅ tikaṅ* tulis atat pra[ya] tuhu-tuhu kadi vruh ojara,</l>
.<l n="c">sākṣāt nāga tulis nyulā kumuliliṅ maṅaṅ avilətan iṅ** laṅit-laṅit,</l>
2440<l n="d">riṅ hulvan pəṭa kāmadeva kanakāṅadga makuṭa*** maṅgəgə̄ laras.</l>
. <!-- <app>a. B. mrik māmbə̄.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ikaṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. kadīṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. matuṭa.</app> -->
2445</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.18" n="18">
.<l n="a">ṅkāne sor inənah* tikaṅ pataḍahan marakata ginave rinū**-pakā,</l>
.<l n="b">śuddhyā ṅ kumbha paḍamvan esi bañu varṇana maṇi kavavan varāmr̥ta,</l>
.<l n="c">arcca pəṭa ṅ śivapatra padma saha ronya maṇimayāmbək tvasiṅ umulat,</l>
2450<l n="d">sə̄ṅ māteja murub katuhvan iṅ apeki tan ahaləpa kelaban damar.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. inədah.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 61 ends here, followed by lontar 64.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>b. B. śuddhaṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
2455<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.32.19" n="19">
.<l n="a">[Sənə̄nikaṅ ratna sphaṭika maṇi]* kadi kumuda mijil sakeṅ bañu,</l>
.<l n="b">Ivir tāpiṅ bhramarāṅasut paradaniṅ paku-paku kumalūṅ aṅambvakən,</l>
.<l n="c">simbar mās paripih midəm anyuki** kuṇḍur*** aniru-niru candramaṇḍala,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir vintaṅ papikat maṇiknya lumarap maṅəḍap-əḍap i vintaṅ riṅ tavaṅ.</l>
2460 <!-- <app>*S. AB. .......kadi.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. anyuka.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. kuṇḍar.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
2465<div type="canto" n="32" xml:id="krsnayana_01.33">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">ndah sāmpun ta[bəh pitu]* vus asove surupniṅ śaśāṅka,</l>
.<l n="b">kulvan vetan humuṅ avurahan śabdaniṅ vvaṅ mataṅhi,</l>
2470<l n="c">ābhāniṅ maṅharəp ataḍah evəh paḍa kārya-kārya,</l>
.<l n="d">gretniṅ siṅgot ya juga karəṅə̄ tan sara** lot maganti.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. sāmpun ta...vus.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. tan upara.</app> -->
.</lg>
2475<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">tatkālāva divasā suməṅ abhrāvās ṅ akaśa deśa,</l>
.<l n="b">mukṣa ṅ taraṅgaṇa sasəkariṅ śrīgaḍiṅ sə̄h sinapvan,</l>
.<l n="c">kahyun-hyun taṅ hima kadi cako bāṅ hijo sarvavarṇa,</l>
.<l n="d">mələkah vimba hyaṅ aruṇa lumə̄ Ivirnya bandega rakta.</l>
2480</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">maṅkin tekaṅ nagara kumisik ghurṇṇitekaṅ garantuṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">paṅhrikniṅ tuṅgaṅan inikət umuṅgviṅ va*-ṇḍirāgə̄ṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">kadbhutekaṅ dvirada madulur tūt ləbuh maṅkat adyus,</l>
2485<l n="d">ghaṇṭa nyāsraṅ** sahur*** masahuran**** ghora śabdanya guṅ-guṅ*****. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 64 ends here, followed by lontar 63. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. nyasvaṅ. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>***S. A. nyasvaṅ saru. B. nyāsraṅ...masahuran.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>****B. A. masahurin.</app> -->
2490 <!-- <app>*****S. AB. guṅgu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">vāhvādan tekaṅ amijilakən peni-peni prakāśa,</l>
.<l n="b">paṅguṅ*ni lāmpuran i ləbuh i rajya śobhān tinonton,</l>
2495<l n="c">pras-prasa[nika i]nadəgakən** ṅkā ri heṅniṅ kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="d">lāvan tekaṅ halun-alun ulul nyāhatəp sarvavarṇa.</l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->Z. I.972 renders lampuran with ’probably travelling singer or player’. This meaning does not fit in the context of the stanza above. I remember, that even today in Central Java especially, in the early evening hours, people sometimes hear noises of ringing bells, and then respond with beating everything that can produce loud noise, such as empty gasoline tins, wooden drums etc while shouting ’lampor, lampor’. G&amp;R II.149 explains that lampor is "a name of an evil spirit, which according to superstitions is sent by the goddess of the South (Ratu Kidul)...etc.”</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->It is interesting to note that lamp or, as the story goes, is not only a messenger of the Queen of the South (Seas), but also her retinue when she is travelling to visit the kings of Java. What is most interesting here is the association of lampor with the Ratu Kidul, who is the Virgin Goddess or Kanyā Kumārī in India. If this is true, then the lampuran tower should be a structure or building where offerings to the goddess Kanyā Kumārī are placed and where she is worshipped perhaps by would-be brides, as part of the wedding ceremonies. Krəṣṇāyana kakavin mentions that at the pamidudukan ceremony, Princess Rukmiṇī went to a pavillion to worship the Goddess of Love (canto 36), but in the Sanskrit sources it is told that she is abducted by King Krəṣṇa on her way back to the palace, after she worships the Mother-goddess.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. paṅgu.</app> -->
2500 <!-- <app>**S. AB. pras-prasa...nadegaken.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">pūrṇa ṅ nyāsāśrja rəpat haləp solahiṅ rājakārya,</l>
2505<l n="b">ṅkāne mādhyāparimita minervāruhur lvir gunuṅ mās‚ </l>
.<l n="c">aṅde ləṅləṅ ləyəp i Kəlab i luṅsir aṅkən limutnya,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir vveni pañcuran ulur ikā mutyahāra praləmba.</l>
.</lg>
.
2510<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">varṇan tekaṅ parajana pənuh makərigan sə̄h manonton,</l>
.<l n="b">vvaṅ-vvaṅ māvan ləvəs acaṅkiṅ* vaṅ denikāhyā sajuṇḍuh,</l>
.<l n="c">anyā tekaṅ lumaku madulur strīnya muṅgvīṅ harəpnya,</l>
.<l n="d">marmmānuntun tanayanika ri maṅikū doh amalaku tinuṅgvi**.</l>
2515 <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->ahyā sajuṇḍuh. Z. I.753 reads ahyās (m)ajuṇḍuh, but gives no rendering. I think ahyā sajuṇḍuh should be read agyā sacuṇḍuk (to come quickly), because the phrase forms the reason why the people come on vehicles, usually not fit for human transportation.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. acakiṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. ri məṅika dakaṅ ma...nuṅgvi.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.07" n="7">
2520<l n="a">dodotnyābhrā dahatən alavas* lagi molək** siginya,</l>
.<l n="b">nityāṅantī pakəkəsan ikin yatna marmma tulisnya,</l>
.<l n="c">yan tonton masasavaṅ ikā ndah samaṅkā hinaṅgo,</l>
.<l n="d">ndan prāyanyāṅḍiri ṅ akuməl a[n dodotnya bəlah ri təṅah]***</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. amavas.</app> -->
2525 <!-- <app>**B. A. solət.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***S. AB. akuməl a...</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">akveh*nyāsanya hana savaneh māmpak-ampak sapaṇṭa,</l>
2530<l n="b">prāptāniṅ jro tapəl** aṅalih i lyan marā ri pavidhvan,</l>
.<l n="c">āmbək vvaṅ thāni tikaṅ avərə̄h*** sarvamaṅde kapūhan,</l>
.<l n="d">darpe tiṅhal manudu-nuduh arṣān mulat riṅ patāka.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB....kvehnyāsa. b. B. bəjo tapəl.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. tapəl.</app> -->
2535 <!-- <app>***B. A. avarəh.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">len taṅ māmpi mara riṅ atavur marubuṅ* sōh lumaṅkuṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">ndan īnaṅ nora tika rinəṅə̄nyālaṅə̄ pūja-pūjan,</l>
2540<l n="c">mpu ṅkvāgyāpan gumirisin** ikaṅ citta deniṅ vvaṅ akveh,</l>
.<l n="d">aṅgrək riṅ ghaṇṭa tumuluy aṅuccaraṇa ṅ mantra sāla.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. maruguṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. girimisin.</app> -->
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->The word māmpi, in my view is derived from ma-(prefix) and ampi which becomes hampir (to come near) in Bahasa Indonesia. The Javanese word is mampir (to drop in for a visit), which is fitting in the context.</app> -->
2545 <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->Gumiriśən is from the base-word giris, which in Javanese still has the meaning of ’intense fear, panic-stricken’.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">māvan pva ṅ kāla nr̥paduhitākambaligyāṅkas-aṅkas,</l>
2550<l n="b">strīni kriyan strīniṅ agati maparək mañjiṅ i jro kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="c">masənāhaṅ maṅgala murava sāmpun matiṅkah haneṅ heṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅ śaivāstāseni* sugata maṅkat sirāśaṅkapānya.</l>
. <!--<app><!-\-note for the reading-\->a. Z. I.785 has only kambala (woollen jacket). I also read nr̥paduhitākambalāgyaṅkas-aṅkas (the princess, wearing her woollen attire, departed hurriedly...). This kind of garment is still worn by princesses and queens in the wayang wong (human shadow-play), though the material is not wool but black velvet.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. śaivāstasani.</app> -->
2555</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.33.11" n="11">
.<l n="a">ken putrī maṅkin aṅavaki rūm-rūmnirāṅ rājalakṣmī,</l>
.<l n="b">muṅgviṅ ratnāsana səḍəṅ aliṅgih pratiṣṭheṅ pasajyan,</l>
2560<l n="c">tan molah tan paṅucap ararəm sopacārābvat* atvaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">sə̄ṅniṅ lambe kadi gumuyu śaśrī baṅun devavimba. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. A. sopābvat. B. sopacābvat.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
2565
.<div type="canto" n="33" xml:id="krsnayana_01.34">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">ndi taṅ vaṅ tan marmmān umulat i halep rājaduhitā,</l>
2570<l n="b">inadyuteṅ sarvābharaṃa sopaniṣkāra rinasuk,</l>
.<l n="c">mapa ṅ katbhutābhrā kadi jaladaniṅ varṣa kanāka,</l>
.<l n="d">baṅun hyaṅniṅ rəm rupanira ni kilatbā*-hu lumarap. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 66 ends here, followed by lontar 65.</app> -->
.</lg>
2575<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">Gəluṅ grət kahyun-hyun arəja matutup mās minaṇikan,</l>
.<l n="b">səkar tajyareh tiṅkah i sarasija nyāriṅi-riṅi,</l>
.<l n="c">kasənvan urṇṇa śrī raras ika rəcəp maṅkin ahaləp,</l>
.<l n="d">mukārūm kambvan deni paden ikiṅ bahu sumavur.</l>
2580</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">gəlaṅ səsəran ṅkāne luṅayanira nāga kr̥tāmilət,</l>
.<l n="b">ikaṅ muṅgvīṅ jə̄ṅ nupura rinancanārje matamata,</l>
.<l n="c">ikət ken marmmāniṅsəti ri panavəṅniṅ tapi-tapih,</l>
2585<l n="d">sənə̄niṅ nīlāśrī pinakapaṅucalniṅ tali-tali.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">maṇikni simsim sə̄ṅ i jariji lumə̄ śuddha vimala,</l>
.<l n="b">kuniṅ rakvekā paṅhala-hala ṅ malaniṅ sarva ginaməl,</l>
2590<l n="c">prabhāniṅ ratnāśrī ri taliṅa kəñar nyāṅhada-hadā,</l>
.<l n="d">avās donanyā norani hala-halanya ṅ sakarəṅə̄. </l>
. <!-- <app>b. B. kunəṅ. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>c. B. ratnāsraṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
2595<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">təṅah ṅ ve nduk sub-sub panas ahuyaṅ āmbək nr̥pasutā,</l>
.<l n="b">magatgat sə̄b-sə̄bniṅ hariṅət ahirit hisnya ri susu,</l>
.<l n="c">savaṅ pə̄hniṅ vveni maṇik atimayāṅimbəhi raras,</l>
.<l n="d">ikaṅ hintən sə̄ṅnyāsmu panu rumantak ya ri jaja.</l>
2600</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">ikaṅ gundik satus ri vurinira sākṣāt ratih ahə̄m,</l>
.<l n="b">baṅun paṅjrahniṅ sarvakusuma miṅiṅ gandhi* asumār,</l>
.<l n="c">ləṅə̄ Ivir jaṅgāśoka surabhi vuṅū tañjuṅ asana,</l>
2605<l n="d">həlarniṅ kumbaṅ yogya tapiha**nikā pantəs aṅəne.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. gandik.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. kapiha.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.07" n="7">
2610<l n="a">haneki strī lvir ketaka sama vāvā kaṇṭaka səḍəṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">tuvi*-n pantəs rūpanya linavə-lavə tan pavaləsan,</l>
.<l n="c">manahniṅ vaṅ harṣāmibikana tapihnyāmər amarək,</l>
.<l n="d">rəsəp raśminyān rovaṅan iṅ avilāgāṭik-aṭikan.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 65 ends here, followed by lontar 68.</app> -->
2615 <!-- <app>d. The word compound avilāgāṭik-aṭikan can be analyzed in two ways:
. a) avi (not) and lāgā (fight) and aṭik-aṭikan (to make love). If this is the case, the translation should be ’not fighting but to make love’.
. b) a- (prefix) and vilāgā (to fight) and aṭik-aṭikan (to make love). In this case, it should be rendered with ’battle of love’. I prefer b).
.</app> -->
.</lg>
2620<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">vaneh mādəg minta təkap i sahəsə̄niṅ gvan arupək,</l>
.<l n="b">təkāsih bhava nyan balisah apipit kenyalibakən*,</l>
.<l n="c">hanan məñcuh ryy ajə̄ṅnya karika ya hetu nyan akədə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">miṅis marmmembuh ṅrəs rəṅu-rəṅunikāṅambvani raras. </l>
2625 <!-- <app>*S. AB. kenyālibabən.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">a tiṅkah saṅ mopih susu kadi pucaṅ danta mabuṅah,</l>
.<l n="b">baṅun kadyāluñcip halisiṅ avalik umrut i rahi,</l>
2630<l n="c">sumuṅsat pvekaṅ kuṅ turidaniṅ asampir vvaṅ araras,</l>
.<l n="d">kapvāṅrəs tvasniṅ vaṅ maru mulat ikaṅ strī vahu-vahu.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">nda nāhan taṅ ceṭyā pamucaṅan arūm anvam araras,</l>
2635<l n="b">ləṅəṅ himpər susuṅ guyu vulat ikānolih amanis,</l>
.<l n="c">manah nyān vāla pvāpi lara-lara luhyātalə-taləh,</l>
.<l n="d">rəsəp muṅgveṅ paṅkvan pupukan atəhər yyopih-upihan*. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. yyopih-upinən.</app> -->
.</lg>
2640<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.11" n="11">
.<l n="a">ikaṅ molek tan his marək atugur maṅharəpakən,</l>
.<l n="b">amūjākən kambaṅ yan alihan atimpuh salah ile,</l>
.<l n="c">kabeh kesyan tekaṅ saji hana maśabdāsriṅ aṅipi,</l>
.<l n="d">prayatne lyan tiṅkahnya mavara-varah svapna raha*-yu. </l>
2645 <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 68 ends here, followed by lontar 67.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.12" n="12">
.<l n="a">nda tan kāntun tekaṅ vijah araras iṅ pahyas ahaləp,</l>
.<l n="b">ḍateṅ rəp* ṅkāne sor asidəha bhavanya saṅi-saṅi,</l>
2650<l n="c">aṅalvālə̄ śabdanya humuṅ aṅgaluh cət hanānalit,</l>
.<l n="d">anambah ndah mantuk tumuluy i huvus nyan pamasilih. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. rəm. c. B. agaluh cət.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.13" n="13">
2655<l n="a">kaluṅhā rakvekaṅ divasa tumuluy hyaṅ divakara,</l>
.<l n="b">mijil* sake jro siṅ sahana saṅ anaṅkil pada mulih,</l>
.<l n="c">apan devī sampun sira pinaripūjā matəlasan,</l>
.<l n="d">tuhun tis-tisnya ṅka ri kadi bañuniṅ sagara murud. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. vijil.</app> -->
2660</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.14" n="14">
.<l n="a">kuneṅ rakyan putrī sira kavəkas asmvalək asumā,</l>
.<l n="b">muvah prapta ṅ rāgāṅani kadi sirəm prāpta sumurup,</l>
.<l n="c">atən ri śrī Kr̥ṣṇāriris i nr̥pati cedi nagara,</l>
2665<l n="d">ikaṅ rāga dveśeṅ tvas ira mavirodhādəh-adəhan.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.15" n="15">
.<l n="a">ikaṅ ceṭī tan sah ri nr̥patiduhitā strīkanagara,</l>
.<l n="b">paḍāṅlīlākən tvas vruh aṅulih-ulih maṅrahatana,</l>
2670<l n="c">ulah bhavanyāsiṅ sahana sumukāna ṅ manah ira,</l>
.<l n="d">hanan līlā śobha* hanan acatu len taṅ nita parih. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. soñog.</app> -->
. <note> Z. reads hana līlāsobag hanan acatu len taṅ nita parih, and renders catu with 1. share, part, portion. 2. It seems to be a kind of game, played by women... It is not clear what game is meant. (I.312); nita with game, playing for a stake (I.1199) and parih with probably falling of the dice, decision in a contest, the person who casts the dice or give the decision (II.1298). G &amp; R. II.219 has parah which means taker, lovah, sigar, paṅkat, meten (to measure, decease, share, divide, grade).
. I think acatu and nita parih are two kind of games, very popular amongst the woman-folk in the palace. Acatu derived from a- (prefix) and catu is so close to catur (chess-game) which it seems already existed in ancient times. In the wayang stories
2675 however, thc chess-game in Indian stories becomes a dice-game, i.e. in the story of Yudhiṣṭhira playing chess is transformed into playing dice (main dhadhu) in the vayaṅ story.
. I understand nita parih as a game, based on arithmetic. Indeed in Java, there is such a game called ḍakon. The game is played on a block of wood with two rows of holes, usually 5 on each side, and a bigger hole on each end. The bigger holes are called lumbung (rice-bam). The other holes are filled with stones (5 or any number). The player takes the stones from one hole on her side and distributes them to the other holes including her own lumbung, with the exception of her opponent’s. Every time she casts the last stone in a hole with stones, she can continue to play, but if the last stone falls in an empty hole on the opponent’s side, it is dead. The opponent then gets her turn to play. However if the last stone falls in an empty hole on the player’s side, opposite her opponent’s hole with stones, it is called mbedil (shooting). She can take all the stones of her opponent in that particular hole to be deposited in her lumbung. The act of shooting can be dramatised by a thunderous "bang". Just then the opponent gets her turn to play. The game finishes with no stones left on one side. The player with the most stones wins the game.</note>
.
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.16" n="16">
2680<l n="a">ri* saṇḍiṅ ken putrī hana kili səḍəṅ pantəs atulis,</l>
.<l n="b">hañar vāhvātaṅkil gəluṅan inapus tapvan agugus,</l>
.<l n="c">kakādyah mūlāṅanti ri siran asih bhakti matuhan,</l>
.<l n="d">pəjahniṅ svāmī mantuka** muvah i jə̄ṅ rājaduhitā***.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ra.</app> -->
2685 <!-- <app>**B. A. pantuka.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. Lontar 67 ends here, followed by lontar 70.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.34.17" n="17">
2690<l n="a">nda yeka marmmāṅlalana ri saṅ akuṅ śoka kalaran,</l>
.<l n="b">manisniṅ śabdāpet sakaraṇanirān maryya sivuhən,</l>
.<l n="c">rikā majar mlechān pamisig iri rovaṅ*ni kavaval,</l>
.<l n="d">vruh iṅ ceṣṭākārā mulat i mata yāṅkən maṅucapa. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. rova.</app> -->
2695</lg>
.</div>
.
.<div type="canto" n="34" xml:id="krsnayana_01.35">
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.01" n="1">
2700<l n="a">dyahku rəṅə̄n iki vacana denta tan parasamen yatan pavaraha,</l>
.<l n="b">paṅlvaṅ ikaṅ vulan rari kakanta mūr alayatāmvītāməṅ-aməṅa,</l>
.<l n="c">rāmya tumūta ri nr̥pati kr̥ṣṇa maṅhera* sarākṣake sukunira,</l>
.<l n="d">dvāravati kaḍatvan irikaṅ parānaniṅ anatpadānasi-nasi.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. maṅhira.</app> -->
2705</lg>
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">rakva haləpnikaṅ nagara rāmya sāgara gunuṅ samīpā kaparək,</l>
.<l n="b">ārya janarddanātiśaya kottamānira mahāprabhāva sinivi,</l>
2710<l n="c">yan hana karyani* ṅhulun aṅaryya ratnaduhitā paveha ri sira,</l>
.<l n="d">tan təṅətən sade**nya tarimakne nr̥pati moñ jugeṅgatakna.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. yan ha...i ṅhulun.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. tan təṅə....denya.</app> -->
.</lg>
2715<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">siṅ* sajulenikiṅ vacana tan papājaraniṅ agrahātaki-taki,</l>
.<l n="b">dvāravati jugeki vuvusən ikaṅ kaləṅeṅanya liṅniṅ avarah,</l>
.<l n="c">riṅ sapuluh kuləm ṅhulun aṅantya tan hana kaginḍal iṅ saparana,</l>
.<l n="d">mitra masih ta yāṅatəra caṅkramāmidera riṅ kaḍatvan i daləm. </l>
2720 <!-- <app>*B. A. saṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">sāmpun ikān muvah ləpasa riṅ vukir licin alālanā lari-lari,</l>
.<l n="b">rāmya ṅ amukti bhukti* sahane talun kaləṅəṅanya taṅkəpakna**,</l>
2725<l n="c">kārttikamāsa kāla kahaḍaṅ*** səḍəṅ raras ikaṅ səkar**** mrik aməvəh,</l>
.<l n="d">rāgāṅ madhubrata ṅhulun ariṅku tan bəsur abhoga sarvakusuma.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 70 ends here, followed by lontar 69. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. sahane talun kaləṅəṅanya taṅkipakna.</app> -->

2730 <!-- <app>****B. A. səḍeṅ ri rasikā kəsta mrik.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">Apan ikaṅ səkar yyan ucape*n pasir saharana nya mon tan avaṅi,</l>
.<l n="b">byakta haneki ra(mi nika rakva tiṅhalana ke*mbaṅiṅ kanigara*,</l>
2735<l n="c">puspa haftar me’kar miṅiṅ rum nya map a ta nimittaniṅ katilara,</l>
.<l n="d">mandalikān rumambat irikaṅpager tuvi yayan maṅambvani laṅb\ </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. kanagara.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.06" n="6">
2740<l n="a">yan səkariṅ vuṅū kaləṅəṅanyan əñjiṅ i turuṅ vijil hyaṅ aruṇa,</l>
.<l n="b">lvir ginugah təkapni rarabiṅ* rərəb-rərəb avor patər tuna-tuna,</l>
.<l n="c">tan hirisən** gagaṅnya tikələn laṅə̄nyan alapən təke kudunika,</l>
.<l n="d">kəmbaṅaniṅ lumampah aməgat gəgər nəhər anāmbyāmət laru-laru.</l>

2745 <!-- <app>**S. AB. harisən.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">yan vuvusən səkarniṅ asanān təraṅiṅ ravi rarasnya maṅkin asinaṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">vāhu hilaṅ kapū-kapunikaṅ himālimunan ahəli tavvan aṅisəp,</l>
2750<l n="c">deniṅ amet karaśmin ika səmpalən saha səmi*nya sə̄h asalaga,</l>
.<l n="d">soṅaniṅ aṅləṅo huvus alūm pva tiṅgalaknāta riṅ yaśa-yaśa. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. məmi.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.08" n="8">
2755<l n="a">tāñjuṅ aśoka kālanikāsiṅ sakahyunaniṅ adyah ahyas asəkar,</l>
.<l n="b">mon inugah aləp yan ikətən yadin savita yogya talya gəluṅan,</l>
.<l n="c">strī sakaka ri* rūpanika pūrṇa ri nvamiṅ aśoka denya mahiḍəp,</l>
.<l n="d">tañjuṅ arūm ləvih vaṅinikān sinor mata raras riṅ pavulatan. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 69 ends here, followed by lontar 72.</app> -->
2760</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">ciṇḍaga konaṅ-onaṅ abuṅah turuṅ vaṅinikā[pan anvam]* inalap,</l>
.<l n="b">māsa ri liṅsiriṅ ravi kalaṅvan-laṅvan ika yan makānak-anakan,</l>
.<l n="c">cāmara karaśmi-raśminika yan hyaṅ arka kumidaṅ-kidaṅ kəñar ira,</l>
2765<l n="d">sumpiṅaniṅ huvusniṅ alulud maṅgə̄ masidəhācəcək havu-havū. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. nika.... inalap.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">kāla panolihiṅ dinakarā ṅ səkar dalima kumram arja sinavur,</l>
2770<l n="b">məṇḍur arūm kapantəs ika sontən ahyaṅ arəjārarəm kadamaran,</l>
.<l n="c">yan kumuniṅ mrəbuk sinirir iṅ samiraṇa kuləm kapantəsan ikā,</l>
.<l n="d">sumpiṅaniṅ katurvan* amajaṅ vulan** gumuliṅākaraṅhulu taṅan.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. katunvan.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. vulat.</app> -->
2775</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.35.11" n="11">
.<l n="a">nāhan ujarnīra mpu kili maṅlipur-lipur i citta rājaduhitā,</l>
.<l n="b">tovi haneki saṅ sama marək paḍāvətu vilāsa harṣa karaṇa,</l>
.<l n="c">rāmya ṅ amarṇa* ṅ racana gīta bhaṣa** riṅ uśāṇa somya rinəṅə̄,</l>
2780<l n="d">parva kathādi*** rakva pinupul-pupul rasanikā laṅə̄ cinarita.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. amarṇanā.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. gīta bhaṭa.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. parva kadādi.</app> -->
.</lg>
2785</div>
.<div type="canto" n="35" xml:id="krsnayana_01.36">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">ndah vvantən paricārikānira pareṅgita hañar aṅalih sakeṅ musuh,</l>
2790<l n="b">kryan-kryan rakva tinuṅgvakən ryy ulah ikān palaki-laki saka*-hyuniṅ mata,</l>
.<l n="c">yekānambut ujarnirā mpu kili toh mapa karika karāmyaniṅ səkar,</l>
.<l n="d">tan śr̥ṅgāra laṅə̄ nda tan rəcəp añəp-ñəpa hati tuna rāga karaṇa. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 72 ends here, followed by lontar 71.</app> -->
.</lg>
2795<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">yan rāntən tapisən tan ora gati maṅləvihana rarasiṅ giṇālaki,</l>
.<l n="b">ndān ākāra saṅ akuləm lavasani ṅvaṅ atəmu rəsəp iṅ karāsikan,</l>
.<l n="c">kampuh vāhu huvus ləsəh katularan ləṅa vaṅi saha gandhaniṅ burat,</l>
.<l n="d">aṅhiṅ ṅkā ri haneṅ payodhara turuṅ hilaṅ i larani vuryaniṅ kuku.</l>
2800</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">eñjiṅ māsa karaśminiṅ karahinān avarurutəna maṅgagap tapih,</l>
.<l n="b">sah maṅləsvi parantiniṅ suku karaṅhulu* ləṅən unusən sakeṅ gulu,</l>
.<l n="c">vāhvāvuṅva kasiṅsalan kusuma sāri sumavur i lukarnikaṅ gəluṅ,</l>
2805<l n="d">mādəg ta ṅvaṅ adan masiñjaṅ irikā n mijil akəmul adhārya-dhāryana. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. naraṅhulu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">sāmpun ta ṅvaṅ adamvadan* hyas apupul rəsəp ajajar aliṅgi-liṅgiha,</l>
2810<l n="b">baṅgin rakva silih sipat-sipat i rāmya paḍavaśa silih titih pupū,</l>
.<l n="c">raśminyān guməluṅ-gəluṅ gəluṅan iṅvaṅ inənah-ənahanya cāmpaka,</l>
.<l n="d">pet-pet sih lukar i tapih pinahayunya sinukər aməḍək maṅol təṅah. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. adhamvadan.</app> -->
.</lg>
2815<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">yapvan māsa huvus taḍah pitu rarasnya kajənəkan asivva riṅ tilām*,</l>
.<l n="b">darpanyān paməḍek-mə**-ḍek śayana rāmya silih adəh-adəh karaṅhulu,</l>
.<l n="c">matrāmvās hariṅətnya yenusapan iṅvaṅ i mukha təka riṅ sələ salaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">leṅleṅnyān paṅidu[ṅ] makaṅsi jariji jaja lamakannikāṅgaməl susu.</l>
2820 <!-- <app>*B. A. talam.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 71 ends here, followed by lontar 74.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">tis-tis ṅ ve nda samaṅkanāturuna riṅ natar umijil saṅka riṅ jinəm,</l>
2825<l n="b">lilāṅhə̄ba ri sor ikaṅ tahən anīs aṅisisakna sə̄bnikaṅ huyaṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ luhyāṅlihāpəpət-pəpəta pādapa maṅadgatākun aṅliga,</l>
.<l n="d">tan vruh ṅvaṅ ri təkanyā harṣaja vaśānukupi mata marək sakeṅ vuri. </l>
. <!-- <app>c. B. ṅvaṅ luhya etc.</app> -->
.</lg>
2830<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">yan tuṅgaṅ gunuṅ aṅlayuṅ-layuṅa ta ṅvaṅ aguliṅ irikaṅ paṅuṇḍəṅan*</l>
.<l n="b">ṅlih-ṅlihniṅ** pinarək aparək sipi rarasnikārəṅu tinakvanan lara,</l>
.<l n="c">ṅkā marmāmrih ika priyambadanikāṅgaməl i taṅan amatya-matyani,</l>
.<l n="d">maṅkin harṣaja rakva yāṅəluk-luk ləṅən ataña ri mūlaniṅ lara.</l>
2835 <!-- <app>*B. A. paṅuṇḍiṅan.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. ni. b. B. pinarək-parək, nikaṅ arəṅu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">yan sore huvusiṅ ḍavuh vvalu karaśminiṅ aṅənəs anīsa riṅ taman,</l>
2840<l n="b">meh-meh mələkaha kəmbaṅiṅ mənur muṅgviṅ taliṅa vahu marma kāṅinan,</l>
.<l n="c">leṅləṅkun mihat iṅ vulan turuṅ avāṅdadari katavəṅan paṅiṅ tahən,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkān lilāmulihe ryy umah ri təkaniṅ kavula marək acumbvaṅundaṅa.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.09" n="9">
2845<l n="a">riṅ ambyan marikin kapaṅgiha* yan aṅhaḍaṅ anəhər anuṅsuṅeṅ guyu,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅvaṅ** prāptāsidəhe*** pupūnya mulate manis i matanikāṅdələ̄ mata,</l>
.<l n="c">tandvāveh səkar iṅ taṅan ya ri təṅən tinarima təhər aṅgamel susu,</l>
.<l n="d">caṅkəmnyāṅulugakən**** səpah garəntən maṅarəki sahajānahut pipi.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. tapaṅgiha.</app> -->
2850 <!-- <app>**B. A. ləṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. Lontar 74 ends here, followed by lontar 73. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>****S. AB. nyāṅluṅakən.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.10" n="10">
2855<l n="a">yapvan rvaṅ galaha ṅ vulan sipi laṅə̄nikaṅ ulah irikaṅ samaṅkana,</l>
.<l n="b">tan sāmvas raras iṅ palaṅka ya ta puṇḍutən alihən umuṅgva riṅ natar,</l>
.<l n="c">ṅkān līlāṅinumāpəḍək-pəḍək karvānaḍah* apan akālihañ cacar**,</l>
.<l n="d">eñjuh rāmya silih larih-larihi yadyapin asuṅa təḍanya taṅgapən.</l>
. <!-- <app>a. yapvan rvaṅ galaha ṅ vulan. This is one way to tell the time. With the word galah is meant the lance or a stick as long as a lance.</app> -->
2860 <!-- <app>*S. AB. karvānatah.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. camar.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.11" n="11">
.<l n="a">ceṭi rvaṅ siki vāhu naṅkil* arəjāharəpakna vagəd riṅ iṅgita,</l>
2865<l n="b">lāvañ jəṅgi rare marək rəsəp amaṅku səḍah aśila tan salah bhava,</l>
.<l n="c">sāsiṅ tan kakuraṅ sārasana rāmya riṅ arəpan umuṅgu riṅ capah,</l>
.<l n="d">roniṅ jəruk lalabiṅ haṅət-haṅət ulihniṅ aṅutus-utus āṅdadak-dadak. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. miṅkil. c.B. kakuraṅ rasan-rasana.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>d. lalab (raw young leaves or vegetable dish). Nowadays lalab is always served together with sambal (chilli-sauce). The way to prepare this dish is in several regions in Indonesia a skill that should be mastered by girls, because sometimes her skill in preparing the sambal and lalab will determine, whether a proposal to marry will go through. In Java, Sunda etc this test is usually conducted at a ceremony called "nontoni" (to see) in Javanese. Some delegates, including the groom to be, pay a visit to the girl’s family, where they are entertained with a meal, with a.o. the sambal and lalab prepared by the bride to be. She has also to serve the guests. During the meal, the visitors, especially the groom to be, have ample opportunity to evaluate everything about the bride to be. This custom is dying out at present.</app> -->
2870</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.12" n="12">
.<l n="a">sāmpun piṅ pat piṅ limāṅinum umeh atəlasa tibā ṅ ḍavuh təlu,</l>
.<l n="b">ndah prapterika taṅ səḍah rəsəp avor kapulaga tan atə̄n apastikā,</l>
.<l n="c">pik-pīkan sabukiṅ banantən alaṅə̄ vavan ika yadin sinuṅakən,</l>
2875<l n="d">ṅ vaṅ rakvāvanəh iṅ sərəh kinajaṅan tan aharəp avavana* pavvahan. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. apavavāna.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.13" n="13">
.<l n="a">liṅsirniṅ śaśi raśmi məhaniṅ aturva hima sumaput aṅravat-ravat,</l>
2880<l n="b">tis-tis tan hana śabda mātra** karəṅə̄ pasahuran i cakiṅkuhiṅ ayam,</l>
.<l n="c">ṅkā ta ṅvaṅ gumuliṅ sumuṅkəm iri paṅkvan ika kadi mahānuru-nurū,</l>
.<l n="d">strī-strī varṇa huval [l]umālana lanāṅulih-ulih alaṅə̄ rinəṅvakən. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 73 ends here, followed by lontar 76. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. mākrak.</app> -->
2885</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.14" n="14">
.<l n="a">tat kale paturūṅkvamogha rasikāṅgugah* anəhər akon umantuka,</l>
.<l n="b">sāmpun mañjiṅatāku riṅ jinəm akālihan alulut aṅayva saṅgama,</l>
.<l n="c">ndā tan mrəm tumuluy ndatan vavaṅ aturva mahayu gəluṅan rusāk mure,</l>
2890<l n="d">sambinyān mihateṅ damar pinupul iṅ tila paṅubuki maṅhaḍaṅ rəṅit. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. rasikāṅgulah.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.15" n="15">
.<l n="a">lāvan teki muvah kalaṅvaniṅ ataṅhya maləṅu-ləṅuhāgarantuṅa,</l>
2895<l n="b">paṅlvaṅ piṅ rva vulan mavā pahañaṅan kararasan i kahayvan purṇama,</l>
.<l n="c">lāmpahni ṅvaṅ alon aləṅleṅ amasaṅ-masaṅa kavula sahya rājasa,</l>
.<l n="d">tan sāhāta sumaṇḍiṅeṅ priya nəhər pagaməlakna rāmyatūt.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.16" n="16">
2900<l n="a">ndā tan səṅgahən aṅrimaṅ-rimaṅ apan dalu sipi rarasiṅ sakaṇṭakā,</l>
.<l n="b">trəptyāmbəkniṅ anon sataṇḍiṅa sarūpa ṅuni-yuni sirāntuhan-tuhan,</l>
.<l n="c">mevəh ṅvaṅ kadi rāja kr̥ṣṇa sira cañcvā pasiriṅan ire sa-kuṇḍina,</l>
.<l n="d">təkvan* kottama darśanīya saphalān tarimanana rara rājaputrikā. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 76 ends here, followed by lontar 75.</app> -->
2905</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.36.17" n="17">
.<l n="a">ndah vvantən sumahur haneki nr̥pa cedi luməvihana kr̥ṣṇa ri sarāt,</l>
.<l n="b">hāh medan kita dūra maṅhiriba rūpanira rari pitovi kahvata,</l>
.<l n="c">tonən taṅ* sulur iṅ vanā riṅ apa yan pamaḍa-maḍana luṅgahiṅ gaḍuṅ,</l>
2910<l n="d">lāvan taṅ kuḍupiṅ trikañcu kapanānraṅa vənaṅa manon ri cāmpaka. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. kasulur.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" n="36" xml:id="krsnayana_01.37">
2915
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">śrī nr̥pavaraduhitāsmu harṣa,</l>
.<l n="b">nḍəṅvakən ucapanikaṅ vara mitrī,</l>
.<l n="c">sə̄h hana guyunira sə̄ṅnya ri lambe,</l>
2920<l n="d">rəp hilaṅ ika kadi vr̥tti dinəmvan.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">rəsnira kaharana ṅ ambək aḍaṅhan,</l>
.<l n="b">karaṇani rəṅunirāṅdadak abvat,</l>
2925<l n="c">lvir (r)asana salaga śabdanirāsrət,</l>
.<l n="d">tan pasarini pandəṅnya hinerher.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">meh aləkas arahupāta sirādan,</l>
2930<l n="b">ndān inarahaknāpan lalu māsa,</l>
.<l n="c">hyaṅ ravi sira makucəm kapaṅulvan,</l>
.<l n="d">megha kuməñar akuniṅ tumahihyaṅ.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.04" n="4">
2935<l n="a">gātraniṅ urut i laṅitnya kuməṇḍəṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">vaspada ri sirəm ikaṅ ravi teja,</l>
.<l n="c">mātra paṅəpər* i kilatnya tan aṅle,</l>
.<l n="d">lvīr kəḍapiṅ apəpəh asriṅ arəbrəb**.</l>
. <!-- <app>c. tan aṅle (not clear, not significant). The translation is based on G &amp; R. I.216. J., Z. and other dictionaries do not record the word.</app> -->
2940 <!-- <app>*B. A. maṅəpər i.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. apaparəb.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">saṅ səḍəṅ aṅaraṅ akuṅ makin onək,</l>
2945<l n="b">deni kaləṅə̄ṅan ikaṅ daśa deśa,</l>
.<l n="c">mandra* paṅətər i patərnika mampə̄h,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir vuvusiṅ aṅayu rāga kataṅhyan. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 75 ends here, followed hy lontar 78.</app> -->
.</lg>
2950<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">nyan sahana racana śunya kakilyan,</l>
.<l n="b">ndan para-paranira yā ṅkan adamva,</l>
.<l n="c">rāmya ginupura havanya kinoryan,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkā ri daləm inupacāra hinaptyan.</l>
2955</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">bvat rati bhavana pasaṅgrahan arja,</l>
.<l n="b">raṅkaṅ ukir-ukiran āpənəd asimpən,</l>
.<l n="c">tvas kayu harəṅ akiris vaṅunanya,</l>
2960<l n="d">mulya kalakah ika danta rinaṅki.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">jəriṅ rumahab i vuvuṅanya masinvam,</l>
.<l n="b">jrah sinulaman i səvə̄niṅ aśoka,</l>
2965<l n="c">jaṅga katirah i tətə̄nya makəmbaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">sə̄b sari garagat ikāna pi maṅhub.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">kirṇa karaṅ i patiganya tiniṅkah,</l>
2970<l n="b">tumpyatak i həni-həninya vatu dyan,</l>
.<l n="c">tan tahu marika natarnya kasapvan,</l>
.<l n="d">sə̄h surabhi rajasa tañjuṅ əhə̄hnya.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.37.10" n="10">
2975<l n="a">ṅkāna paran ira nareśvaraputrī,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅlih-ṅlih ira lumaya mādapa layvan,</l>
.<l n="c">maṅkin aṅavaki manahnira ləṅləṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">mār maṅən-aṅən i pavak nr̥pa kr̥ṣṇa.</l>
. </lg>
2980</div>
.<div type="canto" n="37" xml:id="krsnayana_01.38">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">hāh-ah saṅ hilaṅ iṅ paṅipyan i śəḍəṅkvātaṅhi deniṅ gərəh,</l>
2985<l n="b">ndah siṅsiṅ kahanan ta denya vulikən yan riṅ səkar pādapa,</l>
.<l n="c">yapvan mukṣa kiteṅ rəmə̄ṅ pətəṅ adoh kālaṅkyaṅ asyaṅ-syaṅa,</l>
.<l n="d">yan mukṣeṅ ləpihan tañakna mituhva ṅvaṅ tuduh**niṅ tanah. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. the number of the canto is 36, which is incorrect.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 78 ends here, followed by lontar 77.</app> -->
2990</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">siṅgih yan kita rāja mūrti kahananteṅ sarvamaṅde laṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="b">riṅ lek anvam alək raras kadīnələtan byakta deniṅ limut,</l>
.<l n="c">saṅ māvak patəriṅ bahitra kumətər sore təḍuhniṅ tasik,</l>
2995<l n="d">ləṅləṅteṅ ravi teja meh sumurupāśeśāmaṅun vaṅkava.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">sākṣāt śāstra rahañja-hañja pinakātmāntān paṅanti karas,</l>
.<l n="b">ndātan pāvak avās katon mukha-mukhākārān padadya ṅ ika,</l>
3000<l n="c">riṅ nyudanta kitāṅhadəg lagi katon māyā haneṅ pahyasan,</l>
.<l n="d">muṅgviṅ tvas kita yan sinūkṣma matəmah vaspānaput riṅ mata.</l>
. <!-- <app>c. nyudanta (breasts). The literally meaning of nyudanta is ivory coconut. This type of coconut is always used as a comparison to the beautifully shaped breasts of a maiden. Hence my translation.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.04" n="4">
3005<l n="a">yadyastun kita mañjiṅāməgat arəskvāṅlampva deniṅ lulut,</l>
.<l n="b">ndikin təmva karaśminiṅ saturidāpan durggamākveh bhaya,</l>
.<l n="c">vruhkun tan vənaṅ iṅ madhubrata maṅambuṅ cāmpake jro gəluṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">ndin tan māvrəga kumbaṅ aṅharas anambər jaṅga muṅgviṅ kapə̄.</l>
.</lg>
3010<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">rakryan vruhkvi* kapeṅhinānta mulateriṅvaṅ səḍəṅkvāṅliga,</l>
.<l n="b">byaktātə̄na tumiṅhale təṅah arəka gātra deniṅ bəbəd,</l>
.<l n="c">ndā harṣe trivali n səḍəṅ kaluputan ken yan padandan gəluṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">dūga taṅgəha yan palakvana səpah paṅrāgya rūmniṅ laṭi**.</l>
3015 <!-- <app>*B. A. vruhnvi </app> -->
. <!-- <app>**S. AB. laṭa.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.38.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">hāh vyartheki laṅə̄nikaṅ pakadaṅan rəsniṅ tvas aṅdo*-hakən,</l>
3020<l n="b">tuṅgal riṅ kakavin paḍeki havuniṅ vaṅ riṅ hrəbukniṅ puḍak,</l>
.<l n="c">vvaṅ-sānak ṅhulun i ṭikāpituvi sāprāṇe lavənyān sumār,</l>
.<l n="d">yogyān soṅgvana tan vənaṅ sahapi tan lambaṅ yānuṅgviṅ yaśa. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 77 ends here, followed by lontar 80.</app> -->
.</lg>
3025</div>
.<div type="canto" n="38" xml:id="krsnayana_01.39">
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">səḍəṅ anaṅis marikā nr̥epaputrī,</l>
.<l n="b">hutusan irebu ḍatəṅ sakamantyan,</l>
3030<l n="c">marək umarānaṅguhi* somya sumaṇḍiṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">vacananikā pva vidagdha vicitra.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">ibu paṅutusnira reṇa rahadyan,</l>
3035<l n="b">mapituture kita don i manəhta,</l>
.<l n="c">vuvus ira marma məṅə̄-məṅən asvī,</l>
.<l n="d">amaluyakən mavəkas-vəkas āsriṅ.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.03" n="3">
3040<l n="a">alah ibu rakva tuhanku ta-dandan,</l>
.<l n="b">təkanikanaṅ samayātiki maṅke,</l>
.<l n="c">vahu sumaput pətəṅiṅ vəṅi sə̄b-sə̄b,</l>
.<l n="d">sumahab ikaṅ gagana* mandra patərnya. </l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. ghana.</app> -->
3045</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">ibu mapa deya mapolahani ṅvaṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">iṅət-iṅətən taṅ upāya hayunya,</l>
.<l n="c">pilihana rovaṅaniṅ maviveka,</l>
3050<l n="d">uvah i bhāsa sambhava* pi vruhananta. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. bhāsbava.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">ri halani māsku katon halani ṅvaṅ,</l>
3055<l n="b">niyata hilaṅ sahananya hulunta,</l>
.<l n="c">nya mar inarah sinavarga hanūt təlas,</l>
.<l n="d">syapa tan arəsa kacihnana mātra.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.06" n="6">
3060<l n="a">tuhan i* vijilta samaṅkana mevəh,</l>
.<l n="b">naya putus iṅgita toh ndya havana,</l>
.<l n="c">ikaṅ alavaṅ pakəmit** paḍa yatna,</l>
.<l n="d">saha***-na mariṅ gupurā maḍaṇḍa.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. ni. </app> -->
3065 <!-- <app>**B. A. sakəmit. </app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. Lontar 80 ends here, followed by lontar 79.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">sira nr̥pa cedi tuvin ya haneṅ heṅ,</l>
3070<l n="b">saha bala sañjata dūraka cidra,</l>
.<l n="c">narapati kr̥ṣṇa parānantādoh,</l>
.<l n="d">vəgilan irekin amogha matamban.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.08" n="8">
3075<l n="a">muvah apa tolaha lampunən* iṅvaṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">tuhan apatan ta tumuta manəhta**,</l>
.<l n="c">ṅhulun asiluṅluṅa satya kabhaktin,</l>
.<l n="d">sukha pəjahāguliṅan ri ḍaganta.</l>
. <!-- <app>*S. AB. lampunin.</app> -->
3080 <!-- <app>**S. AB. manahta.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">asmu taṅis vuvusiṅ vara centən,</l>
.<l n="b">saṅ inujaran humənəṅ kadi mona,</l>
3085<l n="c">tuhu marikān sira monā ri lambe,</l>
.<l n="d">humənəṅ i heṅ maṅucap ri daləm tvas.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">kunaṅ agave lara sūkṣma ya mār-mrāt,</l>
3090<l n="b">tuhu marasa ṅ bibi sihnira tam-tam,</l>
.<l n="c">ri pəṅiṅa saṅ bapa tan sapirārəs,</l>
.<l n="d">ri vuyuṅa saṅ kaka yeka kamarmma.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.11" n="11">
3095<l n="a">nr̥pasuta rukma sirāgraja sākṣāt,</l>
.<l n="b">apituvi yogya kabhaktyana māsih,</l>
.<l n="c">apitutur iṅ hayu yatha riṅ antən,</l>
.<l n="d">apan apiṅit pva sire manahiṅ strī.</l>
.</lg>
3100<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.12" n="12">
.<l n="a">nr̥pasuta cedi katə̄n ira maṅgəh*,</l>
.<l n="b">upayanirāpituvin sira tan len,</l>
.<l n="c">nr̥patanayā pva tatan pamisiṅgih,</l>
.<l n="d">pinakalaki hyuna tan saka riṅ hyun.</l>
3105</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.13" n="13">
.<l n="a">nr̥paduhitā malulut ri bapebu,</l>
.<l n="b">vedinira riṅ kaka marmma mavor sih,</l>
.<l n="c">inadə̄h i*-nusira riṅ** nr̥pa kr̥ṣṇa,</l>
3110<l n="d">karaṇani buddhinirān pamitādya***.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 79 ends here, followed by lontar 82.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. ranusira ra.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. pamikādya.</app> -->
.</lg>
3115<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.39.14" n="14">
.<l n="a">muvah aṅucap tikanaṅ vara mitrī,</l>
.<l n="b">ndya ta hurən āṅən-aṅən iki māsku,</l>
.<l n="c">vijilakna ṅ naya pə̄hnikaṅ ambək,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhulun iki dug səḍəṅ epu viraṅrvaṅ.</l>
3120</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" n="39" xml:id="krsnayana_01.40">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.01" n="1">
3125<l n="a">hanāmbək i manəhta māsku ri kitānilib amijil avikva-vikvana,</l>
.<l n="b">gəluṅ vuhələn ārja boddhani kunəṅ susu saputana raśminiṅ jamaṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">ikaṅ rahi buṅahnya bhasmani lamad-lamadni pipi hayva vaspada,</l>
.<l n="d">lumakva saha mekalāraras alon mijil anamar akilya-kilyana.</l>
.</lg>
3130<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">pagaṇitan inupāya cəṅgana halanya yan ahayu harebu hayvana,</l>
.<l n="b">nya tebu ta-lukar tapih ta-basahan paṅudhatana paveha siṅsəta,</l>
.<l n="c">geluṅ sipi rarasnya siṅhəlana raṇḍi mənur inuparəṅga sumpiṅa,</l>
.<l n="d">ulahta ri karājaputryan iki telaṅa halivatane sasambhava.</l>
3135</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">narendra varaputrikā sira gumanti maləsa vuvus ojariṅ saki,</l>
.<l n="b">kakāpa kari deyaniṅ kira-kiranta kili viphala hayva gə̄ṅ tahā,</l>
.<l n="c">kṣinatriya kətaṅ pəjah təkani kahyun ira tuhu agəgvan iṅ hayu,</l>
3140<l n="d">nahan vulati denta saṅ mati kapə̄kan arəbut i sudharmma kaprabhun.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">sraṅən kaka yadin hana vruha rikaṅ gati tupamanātāku kevala,</l>
.<l n="b">huvusta kahu**-vus muvah mulata riṅ nagara ṅuni-yunī daləm purī,</l>
3145<l n="c">tan ahyuna tumiṅhal iṅ piniḍuḍuk ṅhulun ariris aku n payuṅ kuniṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">arəskvāgəḍəg iṅ raga*** mapa karih sahaja muririṅ arəṅə̄ curiṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. srabin.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. Lontar 82 ends here, followed by lontar 81.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>***B. A. rəga.</app> -->
3150 <!-- <app>d. mapa karih sahaja muririṅ arəṅə̄ curiṅ (why should I be in fear to hear about danger). Before in 31.14d I translated təkap ipaṅgyatiṅ curiṅ into ’because someone is coming’. In this context, Rukmiṇī is on the verge to make her escape, and someone detecting her, must represent ’danger’.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">muvah sahur ikāna saṅ vinuvusan ndi ta phalani karāmyaniṅ* sabha,</l>
.<l n="b">təvas kasukrəteṅ laṅāniṅ akirim-kirimana kakavin lavan ṭikā,</l>
3155<l n="c">evəhniṅ anahā-nahāṅiriṅ i rovaṅ inaku dadi tan paṅilvani,</l>
.<l n="d">arəs magigu yan hana vvaṅ aṅucap maguñəpan asalaṅgapan halis. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. karāmnya...sabhā.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.06" n="6">
3160<l n="a">hinur jənəka riṅ pradeśa kasənət kuṭi-kuṭi hana caṇḍi sə̄h vuṅū,</l>
.<l n="b">amuktya rarasiṅ makārvana hurip rumaras avədi petən iṅ yayah,</l>
.<l n="c">aṅantyaməgiləryyumah kakiva śunya kəkəsakna riṅ kadaṅ-kadaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">təkā pva ṅ utusan humundaṅ irikā kudu muliha manəmba-nembaha.</l>
.</lg>
3165<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">Ajambat iki pājar iṅvaṅ apa tenduṅ apa putus ikāṅalapakna*,</l>
.<l n="b">alah mijila māsku hayva masuve pituhu paṅucap i ṅhulun hulun,</l>
.<l n="c">tuhun nr̥pati kr̥ṣṇa tan vuruṅ avās niyata sira kapaṅgihācaḍaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhulun rumuhunātuduh ri kahananta juga ri sira majarāṅlare.</l>
3170 <!-- <app>*B. A. kendaṅapa putras ikāṅalapakna.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">rəcəp vacananiṅ sakhī rūm i maṅanya* hi hati saṅ akārya miṅgata,</l>
.<l n="b">pitovi hana kāladeśa ri palivəraniṅ umijil umañjiṅe daləm,</l>
3175<l n="c">marək sahananiṅ kaparcaya kaka dyah ira paḍa turu** vuvusnira,</l>
.<l n="d">kunaṅ nr̥patiputrikāṅasih-asih manis i vuvus irātulak tala.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 8l ends here, followed by lontar 84.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>**B. A. turuṅ.</app> -->
. <!-- <app>d. atulak tala (to refuse to sleep). Zoetmulder’s II.2054 supposition that tulak tala is ’an instrument or weapon to repel a hostile śakti’ is perhaps based on the meaning of tala (death), so that tulak tala is in fact a formula for survival. The Javanese term at present is tulak bilahi. If we render the phrase in the K.Y. as such, it is acceptable to me, in the sense that Rukmiṇī does not want to go to sleep with the pretence to repel harmful influence that may come from hostile parties. However, I prefer the meaning ’earth, ground’ for tala in the sense that Rukmiṇi just refuses to lie down, to sleep, because she worries too much.</app> -->
3180</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">ri məneh ira lumampahāhañaṅa sūkṣma manah ira tatan kafdi daṅū,</l>
.<l n="b">haras mari hane kisapvan ira ṅuni pamavanira kuṅ tinuṅkulan,</l>
.<l n="c">tikārja biluluk gaḍiṅ kasih irān lagi lalu kasalah sah iṅ susu,</l>
3185<l n="d">karəs ṅrəs iki putra-putranira danta sahaja sinapih dinohakən.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">huvus lumuṅsur* bhuṣaṇātəhər ikaṅ manahən məni sāmpun aṅlugas,</l>
.<l n="b">ri sārah-arah iṅ yayah maṅadəg ādara siran umarək maṅañjali,</l>
3190<l n="c">umaṅkat anilib licin saha sakhī kadi laku-lakuniṅ mareṅ taman,</l>
.<l n="d">tuvin tan asuve lumampah alaris kadi dinudut i rāganiṅ hati.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A. luṅsu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.40.11" n="11">
3195<l n="a">chinidra hinalintaṅan sakahavan təkap ira paḍa tan hanāṅapa,</l>
.<l n="b">huvus halivat iṅ lavaṅ vinavaran kalalu kaləpas iṅ paṅastriyanan,</l>
.<l n="c">narendraduhitāhilaṅ kətir ikaṅ tvas ahəli sukha maṅhəbaṅ-həbaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">avarṇa vahu məntas iṅ lvah adaləm bhaya manah ira mār girahyasən.</l>
.</lg>
3200</div>
.<div type="canto" n="40" xml:id="krsnayana_01.41">
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">madhusūdana maṅhadaṅ (ṅ) aso*-ve,</l>
.<l n="b">təka tekā paricārikān paṅiṅkis,</l>
3205<l n="c">mavarah riṅ ḍatəṅa narendraputrī,</l>
.<l n="d">tan apañjaṅ paṅucapnya tan prakaśa.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 84 ends here, followed by lontar 83.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.02" n="2">
3210<l n="a">nr̥pa kr̥ṣṇa kataṅgamā ṅ anuṅsuṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">ri sira śrī vara rukmiṇī təkāṅlih,</l>
.<l n="c">pinaran tumuluy marək inəmban,</l>
.<l n="d">inənah riṅ ratha solahiṅ paḍāgyā.</l>
.</lg>
3215<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">rarasiṅ sukha harṣa yan kabhukti,</l>
.<l n="b">turidāvor bhaya vādakaṅadəh kūṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">tuhu rakva sirāparək sumaṇḍiṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">lagi haro-hara tekaṅ ambək eṅgi.</l>
3220</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">baladeva kinonakən maṅantya,</l>
.<l n="b">ḍinavuh śabda təkap narārya kr̥ṣṇa,</l>
.<l n="c">mapage nr̥pa cedi yogya toṅgvan,</l>
3225<l n="d">niyata krodha katon (n)agə̄ṅaniṅ praṅ.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">syapa tan katamana duhkha bhara,</l>
.<l n="b">kahuvan vastu hilaṅ sake taṅanya,</l>
3230<l n="c">pituvi pva gatinya meh kabhuktya,</l>
.<l n="d">iva maṅkā lara saṅ narārya cedi.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">ri hilaṅ vara rukmiṇī kaḍatvan,</l>
3235<l n="b">nda samaṅkāvurahan tikaṅ vvaṅ i jro,</l>
.<l n="c">mapatah mapa teki toh mapekā,</l>
.<l n="d">anurakvanu vuvusnya tan pavastu.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.07" n="7">
3240<l n="a">təka taṅ mavarah ri bhīṣmakendra,</l>
.<l n="b">mapaṅavadgata tan pakāladeśa,</l>
.<l n="c">maṅucap tumuluy turuṅ manəmbah,</l>
.<l n="d">mavarah riṅ satinon ikeṅ suputrī. </l>
. <!-- <app>b. B. mapaṅapadgata.</app> -->
3245</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">mavuvuh tikanāṅ ujar mavantu,</l>
.<l n="b">ri hilaṅ saṅ pinakesiniṅ kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="c">nr̥pa kr̥ṣṇa katuduh va*-yaṅ kacūran,</l>
3250<l n="d">maṅalap ratna viśeṣa cora tulya.</l>
. <!-- <app>*B. Lontar 83 ends here, followed by lontar 86.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">nr̥pa bhiṣmaka tan vənaṅ maśabda,</l>
3255<l n="b">ruməṅə̄ ājar-ajarnikaṅ vvaṅ akveh,</l>
.<l n="c">guməgə̄ pavarahniṅ āgamajña,</l>
.<l n="d">pratyavekṣa kamənānira mituhva.</l>
. <!-- <app>d. B. pratuvekṣa.</app> -->
.</lg>
3260<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.10" n="10">
.<l n="a">hana saṅsaya saṅ narendraputra,</l>
.<l n="b">ri para śrī vara rukmiṇī ri cedi,</l>
.<l n="c">kəna rāgā taman* maṅantyakən reh,</l>
.<l n="d">manahiṅ strī viparīta tan sakəlān. </l>
3265 <!-- <app>*S. AB. rāgā...man.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.11" n="11">
.<l n="a">iti maṅkana denirāmikalpa,</l>
.<l n="b">vəkasan byakta varahnikaṅ tumiṅhal,</l>
3270<l n="c">ri vijilniraṅ rukmiṇī prasiddha,</l>
.<l n="d">anilib chidra mare narārya Krəṣṇa.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.41.12" n="12">
.<l n="a">upalakṣaṇa teki riṅ dadi strī,</l>
3275<l n="b">sih iṅ asvāmi ləvih sakeṅ bapebu,</l>
.<l n="c">ndi panona ri dr̥sta ken suputrī,</l>
.<l n="d">mari māsih makalis marāma reṇa.</l>
.</lg>
.</div>
3280<div type="canto" n="41" xml:id="krsnayana_01.42">
.
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.42.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">ṅkā byaktekī layat ira rakryan suputrī,</l>
.<l n="b">tan dvā vrin-vrin prakaśita kaluṅhāṅ vr̥tta*,</l>
3285<l n="c">gəṇḍiṅ māri muni ta ya parəṅ rəp māmpəh,</l>
.<l n="d">sə̄h taṅ vvaṅ riṅ ləbuh alivəran yāḍəṇḍən. </l>
. <!-- <app>*B. A.vr̥kta.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.42.02" n="2">
3290<l n="a">liṅnya byakta ṅ haru-haru gə̄ṅnyekanaṅ praṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">śrī cedyāvās niyata magəlis akrodha,</l>
.<l n="c">ndan tiṅkah saṅ kagələṅan umaṅga mātya,</l>
.<l n="d">āpan ṅ vaṅ śūra niyata tan aṅgā bhagna*.</l>
. <!-- <app>b. B. magələṅ sakrodha.</app> -->
3295 <!-- <app>*B. A. cāghna.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="krsnayana_01.42.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">yan hopən yogya hiḍəpəna tekiṅ śabda,</l>
.<l n="b">rakryan putrī samavavanira śrī kr̥ṣṇa,</l>
3300<l n="c">saṅkśepanyāpi hənəṅaknāpan yo*-gya,</l>
